summary: Poorly maintained foreclosed properties can hurt communities. The agencies we reviewed—Federal Housing Administration, Department of Veterans Affairs, Rural Housing Service—own foreclosed properties. These agencies Oversaw contractors that maintained and repaired properties Generally focused on financial goals for the properties, such as getting a good return Did not always measure if they achieved other goals, like stabilizing communities or selling homes to low-income buyers We recommended...
title: Home Foreclosure Sales: FHA, Rural Housing Service, and VA Could Better Align Program Metrics with Their Missions
